newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila to diversify instruments in capital market.
newsitem.headline: Manila to diversify instruments in capital market.

text.p: The Philippines is planning to introduce new investment instruments in the domestic capital market this year, finance secretary Roberto de Ocampo said on Wednesday.

De Ocampo said the government would open a new trading board for the shares of small and medium-sized companies as well as expand the secondary trading of government securities beyond the present crop of players, which are mostly banks.
The department would also push for waiving of capital gains tax in mutual funds in order to encourage the growth of the industry.

"We are going to democratise the capital market to ensure that the benefits of the capital market will be distributed to a wider segment of the population," De Ocampo said during a news conference in which he announced the 1997 agenda of the finance department.
The development of mortgage-based securities will also be pushed, he added.

Other programmes include the passage of the income tax reform bill, tax incentives for regional headquarters, privatisation of state utility firms, financing for the southern Mindanao island, and improvement of fiscal management of local government units and government-owned and controlled corporations.
